speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: SCENE V. A Heath.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thunder. Enter the three Witches meeting HECATE

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Why, how now, Hecate! you look angerly.

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Have I not reason, beldams as you are,

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Saucy and overbold? How did you dare

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: To trade and traffic with Macbeth

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: In riddles and affairs of death;

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: And I, the mistress of your charms,

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: The close contriver of all harms,

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Was never call'd to bear my part,

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Or show the glory of our art?

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: And, which is worse, all you have done

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Hath been but for a wayward son,

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Spiteful and wrathful, who, as others do,

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Loves for his own ends, not for you.

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: But make amends now: get you gone,

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: And at the pit of Acheron

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Meet me i' the morning: thither he

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Will come to know his destiny:

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Your vessels and your spells provide,

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Your charms and every thing beside.

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: I am for the air; this night I'll spend

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Unto a dismal and a fatal end:

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Great business must be wrought ere noon:

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Upon the corner of the moon

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: There hangs a vaporous drop profound;

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: I'll catch it ere it come to ground:

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: And that distill'd by magic sleights

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Shall raise such artificial sprites

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: As by the strength of their illusion

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Shall draw him on to his confusion:

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: He shall spurn fate, scorn death, and bear

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: He hopes 'bove wisdom, grace and fear:

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: And you all know, security

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Is mortals' chiefest enemy.

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Music and a song within: 'Come away, come away,'  and c

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Hark! I am call'd; my little spirit, see,

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Sits in a foggy cloud, and stays for me.

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Come, let's make haste; she'll soon be back again.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Exeunt
